intro: Dodecatheon conjugens var. viscidum, commonly known as the sticky squirrel corn, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that resemble small, delicate bells. The plant produces a cluster of 12 to 24 flowers on a single stem, which is a key feature of its species name, "dodecatheon." Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a hairy texture, contributing to its overall appearance. The sticky squirrel corn thrives in moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded, well-drained soils.
